query_en: Calculate the sum of column A
explanation_en: SUM function adds all numeric values in column A

query_en: Sum from A1 to A10
explanation_en: SUM function with specific range from A1 to A10
example: Adds values in cells A1, A2, ..., A10

query_en: Calculate total of columns A, B, C, and D
explanation_en: SUM function can add multiple columns by separating with commas, or use SUM(A:D) for continuous range
example: If A total=100, B=200, C=300, D=400, result = 1000

query_en: Sum column A to D from row 2 to row 100
explanation_en: SUM function with rectangular range from A2 to D100 (4 columns, 99 rows)
example: Adds all values in the specified rectangular area

query_en: Calculate average of column B
explanation_en: AVERAGE function calculates arithmetic mean of all numbers in column B

query_en: Average from B2 to B50
explanation_en: AVERAGE function with specific range from B2 to B50

query_en: Average of three columns A, B, and C
explanation_en: AVERAGE function for multiple columns
example: Calculates average of all values across the three columns

query_en: Average column A if column B is greater than 100
explanation_en: AVERAGEIF calculates average of A values only where corresponding B value > 100

query_en: Count non-empty cells in column A
explanation_en: COUNTA counts all non-empty cells (numbers, text, dates) in column A
example: If A has 5 filled cells and 3 empty, result = 5

query_en: Count non-empty cells from A1 to A100
explanation_en: COUNTA with specific range
example: Counts how many cells have data

query_en: Count how many cells in column A are greater than 50
explanation_en: COUNTIF counts cells meeting specific criteria

query_en: Count how many times 'Completed' appears in column B
explanation_en: COUNTIF with text criteria (case-insensitive)

query_en: Find the maximum value in column C
explanation_en: MAX returns the largest number in column C

query_en: Find the minimum value from D1 to D50
explanation_en: MIN returns the smallest number in the range

query_en: Find maximum across columns A, B, C, and D
explanation_en: MAX can compare values across multiple columns
example: Returns the highest value among all four columns

query_en: If A1 is greater than 100, show 'High', otherwise show 'Low'
explanation_en: IF function checks condition and returns different values based on TRUE or FALSE

query_en: If column B is 'Pass', return column C value
explanation_en: IF with text comparison, returns value or empty string

query_en: If A1 > 50 AND B1 < 100, show 'Valid'
explanation_en: IF with AND function checks multiple conditions (all must be TRUE)

query_en: If A1 > 50 OR B1 < 100, show 'Pass'
explanation_en: IF with OR function checks multiple conditions (at least one must be TRUE)

query_en: Sum column D where column C is 'Completed'
explanation_en: SUMIF adds values in D only where corresponding C cell equals 'Completed'

query_en: Sum revenue in column D where month in column A equals 1
explanation_en: SUMIF with numeric criteria
example: Sums all D values where A=1 (January)

query_en: Sum salary in column E where department in column B is 'Sales'
explanation_en: SUMIF for department-based summation
example: Total salary for Sales department only

query_en: Sum column D where column A is 'Male' AND column B > 25
explanation_en: SUMIFS allows multiple criteria (all must be TRUE)
example: Sums D only where A='Male' AND B>25

query_en: Sum revenue where region is 'Hanoi' AND status is 'Completed'
explanation_en: SUMIFS with two text criteria
example: Total revenue for completed Hanoi orders only

query_en: Lookup value in table A:D and return column 3
explanation_en: VLOOKUP searches for F1 in first column of A:D and returns value from 3rd column
example: If F1='Apple' and table has Apple in row 5, returns value from D5

query_en: Exact lookup from another sheet
explanation_en: VLOOKUP can reference data in different sheets
example: Looks up A1 in Sheet2 and returns 2nd column value

query_en: Concatenate first name in column A and last name in column B
explanation_en: & operator concatenates text with space in between

query_en: Join columns A, B, C with dash separator
explanation_en: Concatenate multiple columns with custom separator

query_en: Get first 5 characters from column A
explanation_en: LEFT function extracts specified number of characters from start

query_en: Get last 3 characters from column B
explanation_en: RIGHT function extracts characters from end

query_en: Extract 3 characters starting from position 5
explanation_en: MID extracts substring from middle (starting position, length)

query_en: Convert text in column A to uppercase
explanation_en: UPPER converts all letters to uppercase

query_en: Convert text in column A to lowercase
explanation_en: LOWER converts all letters to lowercase

query_en: Count the number of characters in column A
explanation_en: LEN returns the length of text string

query_en: Remove leading and trailing spaces from text
explanation_en: TRIM removes extra spaces (keeps single space between words)

query_en: Get today's date
explanation_en: TODAY returns current date (updates automatically)

query_en: Get current date and time
explanation_en: NOW returns current date and time

query_en: Extract year from date in column B
explanation_en: YEAR extracts the year component from a date

query_en: Extract month from date in column B
explanation_en: MONTH extracts the month number (1-12) from a date

query_en: Extract day from date in column B
explanation_en: DAY extracts the day of month (1-31) from a date

query_en: Calculate days between two dates
explanation_en: Subtract earlier date from later date to get difference in days

query_en: Calculate months between two dates
explanation_en: DATEDIF with 'M' parameter returns complete months between dates

query_en: Add 30 days to date in column A
explanation_en: Add number to date to get future date

query_en: Get the last day of the month for date in A1
explanation_en: EOMONTH returns end of month (0 for current month, 1 for next, etc.)

query_en: If A1 > B1 return A1, else if B1 > C1 return B1, else return C1
explanation_en: Nested IF functions for multiple conditions (waterfall logic)
example: Returns the highest value based on conditions

explanation_en: Tiered commission calculation using nested IF

query_en: Safe VLOOKUP that returns 'Not Found' if error
explanation_en: IFERROR wraps VLOOKUP to handle lookup failures gracefully
example: Returns value if found, 'Not Found' if A1 doesn't exist in C:E

query_en: Calculate standard deviation of column A
explanation_en: STDEV.P calculates population standard deviation
example: Measures spread of data in column A

query_en: Find the median value of column B
explanation_en: MEDIAN returns the middle value when data is sorted

query_en: Find the 3rd largest value in range A1:A100
explanation_en: LARGE returns the k-th largest value (3rd in this case)
